channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: Green Party wins Gorton and Denton by-election, pushing Labour into third place
item.description: The Green Party has won the Gorton and Denton by-election, with Hannah Spencer taking the seat from Labour in the Green's first ever Westminster by-election victory.

item.title: Chris Mason: Green Party win will prompt soul searching within Labour and questions for Starmer
item.description: Never before have the Green Party won a Westminster by-election.

item.title: Firefighters in Sicily rescue 400 rare books from library after landslide
item.description: Firefighters in Sicily have rescued about 400 rare books from a library in Niscemi that hangs on the edge of a mudflow, after a devastating landslide in January tore away an entire slope of the town and carved a 4km chasm.

item.title: Benjamina Ebuehi’s recipe for coffee and walnut cookies | The sweet spot
item.description: When it comes to British cakes, coffee and walnut is such a staple that if there isn’t one present at a bake sale or coffee morning, I’ll raise an eyebrow.

item.title: North Korea’s ‘most beloved’ child: what the key congress revealed about Kim Jong-un’s succession plans
item.description: When North Korea’s ruling party held a top-level meeting this month there were predictable boasts of unstoppable nuclear development and, more unexpectedly, a suggestion by Kim Jong-un that his country and the US “could get along” – provided that Washington recognised North Korea as a legitimate nuclear power.

item.title: Hannah Spencer wins Gorton and Denton for the Greens and calls out ‘divisive figures’ – UK politics live
item.description: The Green party has pulled off a landmark victory in the Gorton and Denton byelection in a significant blow to Keir Starmer, Josh Halliday is reporting.

item.title: Super Bowl champ backs Burton's boot as good enough for NFL
item.description: Australian Super Bowl winner Michael Dickson says the booming boot of Bulldogs five-eighth Matt Burton could cut it in the NFL.

item.title: ‘Everybody wants a bestie like this guy!’ Rush on rock’s most anticipated reunion – and its greatest bromance
item.description: The two men on the sofa, Rush’s Geddy Lee and Alex Lifeson, have known each other for 60 years now.

item.title: Green party wins Gorton and Denton byelection, pushing Labour to third place in blow to Keir Starmer
item.description: The Green party has pulled off a landmark victory in the Gorton and Denton byelection in a significant blow to Keir Starmer.

item.title: Six months since coming out Mitch Brown believes the AFL will do better
item.description: Three months after ex-AFL player, Mitch Brown, made the historic decision to come out as bisexual he was bailed up by a media staffer at a Lady Gaga concert.

item.title: Sussan Ley won't return to parliament for farewell but is 'proud' of leadership milestone
item.description: SBS acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country and their connections and continuous care for the skies, lands and waterways throughout Australia.

item.title: Why these Sydney beaches have been named Australia's best
item.description: Bate Bay beaches in Sydney's Sutherland Shire have taken out the top spot in Tourism Australia's annual best beaches list.

item.title: Taking collagen keeps skin more elastic but won't stop wrinkles, say scientists
item.description: Taking daily collagen supplements can rejuvenate the skin by boosting elasticity and hydration or moisture - but it won't stop wrinkles, says a new scientific review.

item.title: The Boys' Love at the heart of Heated Rivalry is a familiar tale in Asia
item.description: Charged glances catch across a crowded room.

item.title: Anthropic says it ‘cannot in good conscience’ allow Pentagon to remove AI checks
item.description: Anthropic said Thursday it “cannot in good conscience” comply with a demand from the Pentagon to remove safety precautions from its artificial intelligence model and grant the US military unfettered access to its AI capabilities.

item.title: Anthropic CEO says AI company ‘cannot in good conscience accede’ to Pentagon’s demands
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said Thursday the artificial intelligence company “cannot in good conscience accede” to the Pentagon’s demands to allow wider use of its technology.

item.title: More children in residential care in Qld than other states, inquiry told
item.description: Since July 2025, Queensland's Commission of Inquiry into Child Safety has examined how to improve the state's care model.

item.title: US and Iran make 'significant progress' in nuclear talks, mediator says
item.description: The US and Iran have made "significant progress" during talks on Tehran's nuclear program in Switzerland, according to mediator Oman.

item.title: New image reveals secrets of Milky Way galaxy in stunning detail
item.description: Scientists have captured a beautiful image in unprecedented detail of the vast Milky Way galaxy, of which our own solar system is a part.

item.title: Playwrights’ ‘thrilling’ debuts share the Susan Smith Blackburn prize
item.description: The Susan Smith Blackburn prize for female, transgender and non-binary playwrights has been awarded to joint winners, both for their debut plays.

item.title: US-Iran talks end after 'significant progress', mediator says
item.description: High-stakes nuclear talks between the US and Iran have ended in Geneva after "significant progress", the Omani foreign minister says, though the chances of a deal that could avert a war remain unclear.

item.title: Proactive and expressive: Matildas' master plan for Asian Cup glory
item.description: The 2026 Women's Asian Cup looms as a moment of great importance for football in Australia.

item.title: Ocado failing to deliver on its potential as one of UK’s great technology hopes
item.description: Only six years ago, the boss of Ocado Group was writing the obituary for supermarkets as he predicted that a surge in online grocery shopping during the pandemic had brought forward the hi-tech future.

item.title: India thrash Zimbabwe to revive T20 World Cup hopes and South Africa close on semis
item.description: A rampant India piled up a record total and handed Zimbabwe a 72-run shellacking in a Super 8s contest to revive their Twenty20 World Cup title defence.

item.title: Quick, eco, delicate — what's the best wash cycle to use?
item.description: From fast to eco, delicate to intense cold — the options your washing machine offers up can feel excessive.

item.title: You owe us for rich history, proud Welshman Matthew Rhys tells USA
item.description: Welsh actor Matthew Rhys has said the United States "owes" his homeland for contributing to the country's rich history.

item.title: William and Catherine brave rain in Wales ahead of St David's Day
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales have visited Powys to celebrate community ahead of St David's Day on Sunday.

item.title: Has Corbyn won the Your Party power battle? - The Latest
item.description: Jeremy Corbyn’s allies declared victory after he was voted to be Your Party’s parliamentary leader in an election in which his rival Zarah Sultana was also voted on to the party’s leadership committee.

item.title: Flamm arts festival aims to spark interest in unsung Cornish town of Bodmin
item.description: Art lovers usually bypass the Cornish town of Bodmin as they head to the more obvious delights of seaside galleries in places such as St Ives and Newlyn.

item.title: On Not Climbing Mountains by Claire Thomas review – impressive, for a patient reader
item.description: On Not Climbing Mountains is a novel, but it draws from and references a great deal of actual historical and literary sources, and is told in a curiously impersonal tone.

item.title: David Squires on … the spectacular own goal that united the world
item.description: Our cartoonist looks at Wellington Phoenix goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi’s unfortunate intervention that created global headlines Continue reading.

item.title: Bridgerton's first East Asian family is a beautiful thing, say cast
item.description: Bridgerton having its first East Asian family is a "beautiful thing", say the newest stars of the hit Netflix show.

item.title: ‘Really a lot of amazing beauty’: emails show how model scout connected Epstein with young women
item.description: “In This busyness I feel like fisherman some time I cache quick, some time no fish,” Daniel Siad, a model scout, wrote to Jeffrey Epstein in July 2014, explaining the frustrations of his work scouring the world for future models.

item.title: Five tips to help you get your first job
item.description: The UK unemployment rate among 16 to 24-year-olds is at the highest it's been in more than a decade.

item.title: Perfect for an apocalypse! How the nuclear bunker became TV’s hottest property
item.description: With tech bros investing in vast underground homes to shield them from future horrors, a slew of ‘bunker-buster’ dramas like Paradise and Silo are asking: do they know something we don’t?.

item.title: Guardian joins media coalition to protect original journalism from unpaid use by AI
item.description: A coalition of UK media companies including the Guardian has urged industry peers to back global frameworks ensuring AI firms pay for the journalism they use.

item.title: Hopes 'extremely rare' fossil will unlock answers about evolution of whales
item.description: A 21-million-year-old fossil has been safely removed from the beach at Ocean Grove, east of Geelong, in what has been described as one of the largest and most complicated excavations in Victorian history.

item.title: Britain and the US, calm down. The gen Z Chinamaxxers will do you no harm | Coco Khan
item.description: As it’s Chinese lunar new year, it would not be surprising if you’ve found yourself scrolling through some China-inspired content.

item.title: ‘The most important part is the vibe’: Bate Bay named Australia’s best beach
item.description: The Sutherland shire’s Bate Bay has been named best Australian beach for 2026.

item.title: Labour must search its conscience if Reform wins Gorton and Denton, says Green leader
item.description: The polls have opened in the three-way battle for Gorton and Denton in south-east Manchester in one of the most unpredictable byelections in years.

item.title: 'Luke Littler effect' inspiring young people to step up to the oche
item.description: Darts has certainly had a sea-change in the last number of years.

item.title: What a Gorton byelection win would mean for Reform, Greens and Labour
item.description: The Gorton and Denton byelection is the biggest electoral test yet for Keir Starmer before what are expected to be disastrous results for Labour in the May local elections.

item.title: ‘Magic beneath the surface’: pioneering geothermal plant launched in Cornwall
item.description: Just outside the perimeter fence stand the hulking remains of grand stone engine houses, a testament to Cornwall’s proud tin and copper mining history.

item.title: Aussies focused on repeating 'perfect performance' against India
item.description: Ash Gardner says the Australians focused on their own game during the series-opening win over India.

item.title: Anthony Albanese take note: Human rights apply to all Australians – not just those deemed to be worthy | Daniela Gavshon
item.description: Human rights are not applicable only to some people.

item.title: Qantas shares fall more than 6 per cent after first-half profit announced
item.description: Qantas has reported a flat first-half statutory net profit of $925 million, up $2 million on the same period last year.

item.title: Town learns its water is 'only good to flush the toilet' with after 66 years
item.description: Residents of Sunset Strip have discovered via a letter shared to Facebook by a new resident that their water is "only good to flush the toilet" with.

item.title: How shed boxes became one of the most precious collections in Australia
item.description: Warning: This story contains images of Indigenous people who have died.

item.title: Swedish vocal quartet Åkervinda among highlights in annual radio festival on ABC Classic
item.description: In 2026, ABC Classic marks 10 years of celebrating music by women, with their annual Festival of Female Composers.

item.title: Live: ASX poised for fresh record as Wall Street powers higher
item.description: Wall Street is extending its tech-led rally ahead of Nvidia results that are due to be released after the US market closes.

item.title: Summer Games gold medallist sets sights on success in snow at Milan
item.description: Paralympic gold-medal-winning triathlete Lauren Parker will compete at the Milano Cortina 2026 Paralympics, becoming a dual-games athlete.

item.title: Super industry sounds alarm about increased switching to 'riskier' funds
item.description: More Australians are switching to "riskier" super funds, up 17 per cent over the past year, according to Super Members Council.

item.title: Steve Borthwick turns to 2003 World Cup heroes for Six Nations inspiration
item.description: Steve Borthwick has turned to England’s 2003 World Cup winners to arrest his side’s drastic decline after enduring another setback with the scrum‑half Alex Mitchell ruled out for the rest of the Six Nations.

item.title: Preaching kindness, Amanda Seyfried went all in on her latest role
item.description: A gifted singer and dancer, luminous Hollywood star Amanda Seyfried is a dab hand at musicals.

item.description: One of the things that has been frequently puzzled over as the effluent of the Epstein story flows on, is how a college dropout who thought it was cool to do typos managed to persuade the world’s most powerful into his lair.

item.title: ‘I just want to be free’: Australian children held in Syrian camps reveal their hopes and dreams
item.description: The first thing Layla did when she left al-Roj camp was stick her head out the car-window.

item.title: HSBC bankers to share $3.9bn bonus pot, the highest in more than a decade
item.description: Bankers at HSBC are to share a bonus pot worth $3.9bn (£2.9bn), the highest in more than a decade, after Europe’s largest lender reported better-than-expected annual results.

item.title: Scotland fans secure Fifa approval to wear sporrans at World Cup
item.description: The Tartan Army have been given the green light to wear sporrans with their kilts at World Cup matches this summer, the Scottish Football Association (SFA) has confirmed.

item.title: Tax credits for solar panels are available, but the catch is you can't own them

item.description: The Queensland government is looking at building a secure care facility to assist young people living in state care with mental health needs who pose a danger to themselves or others.

item.title: A poetry collection inspired by a shouting match wins $100k prize
item.description: When Evelyn Araluen won the Stella Prize in 2022 for her debut poetry collection, Dropbear, it was a complete surprise.

item.title: Energy bills will fall by £117 for millions of households in Great Britain from April
item.description: Annual energy bills will fall by £117 for millions of households from April after Rachel Reeves’s plan to cut £150 a year from bills was partly foiled by rising costs.

item.title: Opposition to expand Melbourne CBD in bid to boost home ownership
item.description: The state opposition has vowed to expand residential living in Melbourne's CBD and disrupt plans for higher-density housing in the city's middle-ring suburbs if the party wins November's state election.

item.title: Woolworths shares surge as food sales and profit beat expectations

item.title: Pharmacists say better access needed to home medicines program
item.description: Pharmacists are calling for a budget increase and removal of caps for a home medicine review program, which they say keeps people out of hospital and may even extend lives.

item.title: Woolworths reports 16% jump in profits as ACCC prepares legal action over ‘illusory’ discounts
item.description: Woolworths has reported a significant 16.4% rise in profit, helped by expanding its margins in its key supermarket business.

item.title: NHS secures bone cement rescue package so joint surgery can resume
